content:
# Winners of 26th edition of AGH Diamonds-- AGH UST 

URL: https://agh.edu.pl/en/students/news/detail/winners-of-26th-edition-of-agh-diamonds
Crawled: 2025-03-19 21:22:21

Winners of 26th edition of AGH Diamonds 

 17-02-2025 

 awards 

 The results of the 26th edition of the AGH University competition for the best thesis, “AGH Diamonds” [PL: Diamenty AGH], are in. 

Category: the best application thesis

1
st
 place – the grand prize
 author: Magda Kocyan, Faculty of Materials Science and Ceramics
 topic: “Opracowanie implantu do bezszwowego zamykania pooperacyjnych perforacji i przetok w obrębie przewodu pokarmowego dla potrzeb pacjentów z chroniczną otyłością” [a thesis on the development of an implant for sutureless closure of postoperative perforations and fistulas in the gastrointestinal tract for patients with chronic obesity]
 supervisor: Professor Ewa Stodolak-Zych, Faculty of Materials Science and Ceramics

2
nd
 place
 author: Malwina Furgała, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Automatics, Computer Science, and Biomedical Engineering
 topic: “Biomaterials for theranostics”
 supervisor: Dr Patrycja Domalik-Pyzik, Faculty of Materials Science and Ceramics

3
rd
 place
 author: Kamil Kwarciak, Faculty of Computer Science
 topic: “Unsupervised segmentation of defective skulls in volumetric data by using deep networks dedicated to modality transfer”
 supervisor: Dr Marek Długosz, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Automatics, Computer Science, and Biomedical Engineering

Category: the best theoretical thesis

1
st
 place – the grand prize
 author: Yuya Sato, Faculty of Energy and Fuels
 topic: “Development of distributor-type membrane reactor for carbon dioxide recovery”
 supervisor: Professor Grzegorz Czerski, Faculty of Energy and Fuels

2
nd
 place
 author: Karolina Wojtanek, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Automatics, Computer Science, and Biomedical Engineering
 topic: “Funkcjonalizacja porowatych rusztowań cyrkonowych do regeneracji tkanki kostnej” [a thesis on porous zirconia scaffolds for the regeneration of bone tissue]
 supervisor: Professor Elżbieta Pamuła, Faculty of Materials Science and Ceramics

3
rd
 place
 author: Tomasz Lamża, Faculty of Computer Science
 topic: “Hyperparameter tuning for quantum combinatorial optimization algorithms”
 supervisor: Dr Katarzyna Rycerz, Faculty of Computer Science

Back
